ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: No, I swear by the evening glow,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: So indeed I call to witness the evening twilight,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Nay; I swear by the twilight;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: I do not need to swear by the sunset,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: So by oath of the late evening’s light.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: But no! I swear by Ash-Shafaq;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: But nay! I swear by the sunset redness,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: No! I swear by the twilight
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Oh, I swear by the afterglow of sunset,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: I swear by the glow of sunset,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: I swear by the afterglow of sunset,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: I swear by the evening glow,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: So I do call to witness the ruddy glow of Sunset;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: So I swear by the afterglow of sunset;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: So I swear by the twilight glow
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [84:16] So I swear (fa-lā: lā is extra) by the twilight (al-shafaq), the reddishness visible in the horizon after the sunset,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Oh, I swear by the afterglow of sunset,
